definition: bored/to be fed up with/sick and tired of sth
to feel vexed/to bother/to trouble/superfluous and confusing/edgy

sentences.english: Long enough to become bored with them.
sentences.chinese: 一次就足以让我腻烦了它。

sentences.english: I'am tired of all these jealousies and quarrels.
sentences.chinese: 我腻烦了这些猜忌和争吵。

sentences.english: I’m just a bit fed up.
It was a most tedious business.
sentences.chinese: 这原是一种顶腻烦的事儿。

sentences.english: She' s very blase about parties.
He says he’s tired of the challenger’s contradictory statements.
sentences.chinese: 他说他对手那些自相矛盾的词语令他感到腻烦。

sentences.english: He is a fed up student.
sentences.chinese: 他是一位感到腻烦的学生。

sentences.english: He was tired of those mealy-mouthed politicians.
sentences.chinese: 他腻烦那些油嘴滑舌的政客。

sentences.english: Tired not tired, so quick tired to death?
sentences.chinese: 累不累，这么快就腻烦了怎样可以呢？

definition: bored/fed up with sth/sick of sth
tired of/fed up/sick/(of a person) to annoy/tiresome
to be weary of/to be fed up with/tedious
(of a couple) to be sweet to each other/lovey-dovey/variant of 膩味|腻味[ni4 wei5]
to feel vexed/to bother/to trouble/superfluous and confusing/edgy
to lose all interest in life (idiom)
